page.title: 09Farming - Severn Valley/Wyre
page.content: A rich agricultural area bordering a river basin. Mainly mixed farming with cereals, fruit, sugar-beet (refined locally), dairy and beef cattle. Milk is collected daily by the Milk Marketing Board, beef is auctioned at local cattle markets and free-range eggs are available from farmhouses. At Bite Farm several rare breeds of sheep and goat are kept which are listed by the Rare Breeds Survival Trust. These are: Bagot, Golden Guernsey and Pigmy goats; Herdwick, White Faced Woodland, Soay, Portland and North Ronaldsay sheep: kept for conservation purposes only. A tradition has built up of smallholdings selling their produce on the roadside; plums, apples and cherries from the orchards and a selection of vegetables. A recent innovation is 'Pick Your Own' fruit and vegetables at lower prices.
